alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 2:28PM AKDT until May 19 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 10 PM AKDT FRIDAY FOR UPPER TANANA VALLEY AND THE FORTYMILE COUNTRY... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 1 PM to 10 PM AKDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * TIMING...From 1 PM to 10 PM AKDT Friday. * WINDS...Southeast 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 21 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid to upper 70s. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires are possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
